> " Rodimus, I want you to mak=
e a run for the door, take the others with you, including Darkhawk, and for=
m a protective barrier around him. Legacy is going to open an escape path f=
or us. But first, it's about time I won our side some pay back."

Rodimus s=
tarted to nod, but then looked at Tuscon, his jaw dropping!
He did step bac=
k so that he could better cover the battle scene, but
as he glanced about t=
he odds seemed to be heavily stacked against
them. He shook his head, "Tusc=
on! I cannot let you sacrifice yourself.
It was I who started all of this, =
and it is I who needs to step in.
The Autobots will need you to hold everyt=
hing together."

> He cracks his knuckles and stares coldly at Cyclonus.
>
=
> " You want to take the Autobots down, you'll have to get past me first, C=
yclonus! And this time, I'm not holding anything back!"

Cyclonus smiled at=
 Tuscon as he turned to face him, "Then it is as I
hoped." he said, bowing =
his head slightly at the new prime, his optics
never leaving Tuscon's - the=
 gesture of one warrior to another.

> Night Shift reports to Legacy, Lord =
Elder,Rat Trap, Lord Perseus, and Quickstride.
>
> "Yo, Night Shift here, I=
'm broadcastn' from Ninjabot Radio Network, you're missn' some real hot ten=
sion buildn' up in here. I think Tucson Prime's sick of Cyclonus's scrap an=
d he's lookn' ta go one on one ta show 'em what he's really made of. I ain'=
t never seen 'em this steamed off but slag, he's got a look in his face lik=
e he's itchn' ta do some major damage. Maybe you'll get in here just in tim=
e ta take advantage of some newly fallen spare parts.. Maybe, that's if the=
re are any."

Legacy's cold voice intoned over the communication grid, "Ill=
ogical.
The situation that you are in is repleate with unknown variables an=
d
permutations. To deduce a victory with such an unstable set of
parameters=
 illogical and extremely dangerous."  Legacy paused as the
sounds of explos=
ions could be heard in the background, "I will be
there momentarily."

> " =
This is it Rodimus, this is where our tables are going to turn, and then, w=
e will make these Predacons and Decepticons eat their words. We aren't goin=
g to run, we're going to fight and we're going to give it our all! AUTOBOTS=

UISH OUR ENEMIES! WE'RE GOING TO TAKE BACK THIS PLANET AND TURN THINGS AROU=
ND FOR THE INNOCENT! THIS FIGHT IS FOR FREEDOM, NOT POWER, AND WE WILL TAKE=
 IT BACK!"

Rodimus nodded as well as he turned to face the oncoming seemin=
gly
endless hoard of Decepticons and Predacons, "We stand together then
Tus=
con." he said, trying to sound more confident than he was. he knew
the odds=
, even without Legacy's cautious wording. Rodimus' weapon was
growing quite=
 warm in his hand with the repeated use it was getting.

> He waits with an=
ticipation. Inside Tucson Prime pauses for just one moment, and then with a=
lmost a roar in his voice..
>

>

ucson Prime throws a powerful punch and launches one of his large missiles =
from his missile carrier, attempting to open fire on the enemy to shake the=
m up a bit. Night Shift attempts to do the same with his photon blast riffl=
e.

> " That's right, you be messn' with the wrong bots slag balls!"

All =
manner of sounds and light errupt through the halls as Tuscion's
missiles f=
ly through the air. However the missles failed to reach
their intended dest=
ination as small rockets flew through the air from
the Predacon side, deton=
ating the missles prematurely.

"No, I think we have the correct ones after=
 all." said another cold
voice as Jhiaxus stood thier in the midst of the s=
moke and debris from
the missile, the anti missile defence obviously of his=
 doing. "You
have lost Tuscon Prime." Jhiaxus said, his voice all confidenc=
e as he
brought his own weapon to bear. He smiled at Rodimus, "And soon you=

both will be among the Predacon ranks! Bwhahahhaa!!!!"

Meanwhile as the o=
thers fight it out, Nightrazor shimmered and
appeared next to Darkhawk and =
behind Nightshift! What he was about to
do was difficult to tell, because i=
nstead of completing the move the
floor beneath his feet began to rumble as=
 large cracks ran through the
entire hallway!

It would seem that these hal=
lways were not designed to take on the
full brunt of two primes and several=
 leader class Predecaons,
Decepticons and other various soldiers. So the wa=
ll shuddered and
spilt as finally the floor gave way, sending the entire se=
ction of
hall plunging downward nearly 60' into a large open cavern!

The c=
avern was incredibly large, the cieling reaching up nearly the
entire dista=
nce back to the black Fortress above it. This chamber
looks to be totally u=
nused, an natural chamber that shifted itself
under the fortress over the c=
ourse of time. The chamber itself is hot,
the smell of sulpher and ash can =
be detected. The fact that this room
is not filled with searing, superheate=
d liquid stone is miraculous.
However it is obvious that too much firepower=
 in this room would bring
tons of it pouring into this area at a moment's n=
otice!

There do not appear to be any exits from this room save the one abo=
ve,
although a brave soul could perhaps try to make one . . . and risk
brin=
g in the magma that most likely surrounds this room.

60 feet above the cha=
mber Legacy finally made it to the room above and
screeches to a halt. He s=
ends his scanners peering downward, "A most
interesting development." he sa=
id as he considered what to do to help.
